alert.note: Alert for Gladwin (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 7:44AM EDT until March 26 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: .Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain fell across and upstream of the warned area during the past 24 hours. Ponding of water over walkways near the Cedar River in Gladwin has been reported by emergency management. Water is reported to still be rising. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Lower Michigan, including the following county, Gladwin. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
